Class DT

public class DT
extends java.lang.Object

A utility package supporting Date and Time conversions.

Author:
Keith W. Boone

Method Detail

asUTCString

public static java.lang.String asUTCString(java.util.Date date)
Convert a Date in the current locale to a String representing that date in ISO8601 format (without punctuation).

Parameters:
date - The date to convert.
Returns:
A string representing the date in ISO8601 format.

parseISODate

public static java.util.Date parseISODate(java.lang.String date)
Parse a string containing a date in ISO8601 format (with or without punctuation) into a Date object

Parameters:
date - A string containing the date in IS8601 format.
Returns:
A Date object representing that date/time.

parseDate

public static java.util.Date parseDate(java.lang.String date)
Parse a date in long integer format representing a date as an offset in seconds from Midnight, January 1, 1970

Parameters:
date - A string containing the date specified as offset in seconds from the EPOCH
Returns:
A Date object representing that date

formatISODate

public static java.lang.String formatISODate(java.util.Date date,
                                             boolean isXML)
Format a date into ISO8601 format. If isXML is true, use the XML form, otherwise, use the unpunctuated form preferred by HL7 and IHE.

Parameters:
date - The date to convert.
isXML - true if punctuated format is to be used, false otherwise
Returns:
The formatted date
